Key Match Events: The LA Lakers stepped up defensively in the third quarter, limiting the Philadelphia 76ers to 21 points.
James and Co. answered every Philly mini-run to win 116-106.
Post-Match Reflections: The victory improved the Lakers' record to 5-4 and dropped the 76ers slate to 1-7
Miscellaneous Highlights: The LA Lakers ended a two-game losing streak on Friday with a 116-106 victory against the Philadelphia 76ers.
The gritty 76ers got contributions from across the roster to give the home team a fight.
LeBron James did not score a point but had six rebounds, four assists and three blocks in the first quarter.
The Frenchman's energy and hustle boosted the visitors who trailed 68-60 at halftime.
LeBron James had seven points and four assists in the third quarter to help LA to a 96-81 lead entering the final frame.
Others: Gerschon Yabusele came off the bench to add 11 points, three rebounds and one steal.
The hosts started hot behind Anthony Davis who had 15 first-quarter points.
Paul George, Andre Drummond and Kyle Lowry kept the 76ers within striking distance.
